formalpara.title: Figure 2. Orthology between C. elegans and C. briggsae kinases
formalpara.para: Squares indicate likely orthologous pairs of kinases, and circles denote paralogous expansions. C. briggsae sequences are predictions (CBGnnnnn) from the genome project. (A) In the worm-specific KIN-16 family, new genes continue to arise in the elegans and briggsae lineages, as indicated by circles. (B) In the CDK family, all 13 members exist as orthologous pairs and subfamilies (labeled) are also conserved in Drosophila and human.
